title.narrative: SI2-SOCIAL PROTECTION FOR CHILDREN

description.narrative: By 2021, the most vulnerable children, women, adolescents and young people have access to coherent social protection services., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Evaluation And Research, Social Protection. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Harnessing Power Of Business And Markets, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2021 Children's rights are better documented, and the Government uses these records to inform, cost and implement inclusive social policies.

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the most vulnerable children, women, adolescents and young people have access to coherent social protection services.

description.narrative: The ecosystem of work on social protection in 2019 is still dominated by the strengthening of the system. The draft national social protection policy document has been finalized and is now following the national adoption process. This will lead to a more comprehensive approach in social protection. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:03/02/2020
